Subjective: Hard stools for 3 months; infrequent bowel movements (every 2-3 days); abdominal cramps; bloating; underweight; low appetite; tried olive oil for stool softening; concerned about seriousness; family history of low weight; sister has ulcerative colitis but no similar symptoms.
Objective: Normal bowel sounds; tympany on percussion; sensitive lower left abdomen.
Assessment: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) with constipation; no alarm symptoms (no weight loss, blood, or fever).
Plan: Prescribe psyllium fibre sachets daily with water for 6 weeks.
Monitor for red flags: worsening pain, fever, blood in stool.
